title: How to Use the Black & Decker AccuMark Picture Hanging Level

steps.headline: Place the Black & Decker AccuMark Picture Hanging Level on the back of the picture you wish to hang.
steps.description: Locate the tabs that are on the back of the picture that are used to hang the picture. The rubber grips will keep it from sliding.

steps.headline: Move each adjustable marker on the picture hanging level to match the hanging tabs on the back of the picture.
steps.description: Line each adjustable marker up perfectly with the tabs.

steps.headline: Hold the Black & Decker AccuMark Picture Hanging Level up to the wall where you wish to hang the picture.
steps.description: Because the level has rubber grips on the back, you can actually hold the level with one hand, and it should not slip. You simply need to apply a small amount of pressure. The rubber grips should hold the level in place and not leave any marks on the wall.

steps.headline: Use a pencil to make marks on the wall where you have set each adjustable marker.
steps.description: You can make the mark with one hand while you are holding the level with the other hand. The level is very lightweight and easy to handle.

steps.headline: Install picture hangers at the places where you have made the marks on the wall.
steps.description: You may use nails, screws, or other types of hangers.

steps.headline: Hang the picture on these hangers.
steps.description: Because you have used this picture hanging level, the picture should be perfectly level.
